titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the David G. Henderson papers, 1926-1988 MS2173
titlestmt.author: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-11 11:40:32 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

did.abstract: Collection contains memoranda, correspondence, reports, handbooks, publications, articles, bibliographies, conference materials, photographs, catalogs, notes, and architectural drawings collected by David G. Henderson in the course of his career as an architect for the National Park Service. The material dates from 1926-88 (bulk: 1963-82). The collection deals with issues of historic preservation. It includes internal National Park Service memoranda, guidelines, procedures, and policies, as well as general background information about the preservation and restoration of historic structures. The collection also includes plans and reports for the restoration and maintenance of several national parks and historic sites around the United States.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: David G. Henderson papers, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by David G. Henderson in 1990. A number of books were included with this donation. They have been separated from the manuscript materials and are now housed in the general collection.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: David G. Henderson worked as an architect specializing in historic preservation. He was employed by the National Park Service's Office of Environmental Planning and Design's Denver Service Center and Eastern Service Center.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains memoranda, correspondence, reports, handbooks, publications, articles, bibliographies, conference materials, photographs, catalogs, notes, and architectural drawings collected by David G. Henderson in the course of his career as an architect for the National Park Service. The material dates from 1926-88 (bulk: 1963-82). The collection deals with issues of historic preservation. It includes internal National Park Service memoranda, guidelines, procedures, and policies, as well as general background information about the preservation and restoration of historic structures. The collection also includes plans and reports for the restoration and maintenance of several national parks and historic sites around the United States.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: Subject files and Reports and plans.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains memoranda, correspondence, reports, handbooks, publications, articles, bibliographies, conference materials, photographs, catalogs, notes, and architectural drawings collected by David G. Henderson in the course of his career as an architect for the National Park Service. The material dates from 1926-88 (bulk: 1963-83). The series includes internal National Park Service memoranda, guidelines, procedures, and policies, as well as general background information about the preservation and restoration of historic structures. Of particular interest are materials relating to the restoration of the White House.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: A set of architectural drawings have been removed from this folder and placed in MS2173-S001#00001.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains master plans, historic structure reports, studies and other documents related to several national parks and historic sites around the United States. The material dates from 1968-82. David Henderson either wrote or contributed to most of these documents. In addition to providing detailed architectural information about the historic sites, the documents also describe the history of the sites and their role in the larger community and region. They provide a framework for the cultural and historical interpretation of the sites and structures they describe.
